page.title: 04Visiting Birds
page.content: { Visiting Birds { ************** { In the winter the number of birds {around the area increases as birds {from more northerly parts winter on {the Dee. There are many such birds but {amongst them can be found}Dunlin, Knot, Oystercatchers, Godwits, Curlew, Redshanks,{and}Sandpipers.{Many {wildfowl also can be found including Shelduck{which seems to favour the {Gayton marshes,}Wigeon, Pintail, Teal, Mallard, Merganser, Goldeneye, Grebes, Divers, Guillemots.{There are also {many}gulls, green-fin ches, buntings, pipits{and}chaffinches also visit the{Dee.}Water Rails{also {favour the Gayton to Parkgate stretch {of the marshes and}owls{can also be {found here.
